snippet: An escape route was set up by the United States government, under a 2006 program that offers American residency to Cuban medical workers posted overseas.
abstract: United States government program started in 2006 giving residency to Cuban medical workers has been criticized by Pres Raul Castro and is reminder of differences that still exist between two nations despite diplomatic thaw; Castro government says such policies have created migration crisis as Cubans seek to leave country to take advantage of rules that afford them special opportunities in America; number of Cuban medical professionals defecting for residency in US has reached record level in 2015.

byline.original: By VICTORIA BURNETT and FRANCES ROBLES

lead_paragraph: An escape route was set up by the United States government, under a 2006 program that offers American residency to Cuban medical workers posted overseas.

headline.main: U.S. and Cuba at Odds Over Exodus of the Island’s Doctors
headline.print_headline: Cuba-U.S. Ties Being Strained as Doctors Flee
